meanings.definition: To release or disconnect (something) from a hitch.
meanings.sent1: He unhitched the trailer from the car.
meanings.sent2: The cowboy unhitched the horse from the post.
meanings.sent3: After a long journey, the tired traveler finally unhitched his heavy backpack.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she had unhitched herself from all the stress of work.
meanings.sent5: The magician unhitched the chains with a flick of his wrist, leaving the audience amazed.

meanings.definition: To separate or detach oneself from a situation or relationship.
meanings.sent1: She decided to unhitch herself from the toxic friendship.
meanings.sent2: The explorer unhitched from the group to explore the cave alone.
meanings.sent3: In the movie, the character unhitched from reality and entered a dream world.
meanings.sent4: The idea of starting a new life made her feel like she was unhitching from her past.
meanings.sent5: With a deep breath, he unhitched from his fears and took the leap.
